title: spack install and "self.prefix_lock.release_read(), assert self._reads > 0"
body:
Creating this issue in case it helps to find out some inconsistencies: 

I was trying to install gcc => then network connection dropped =>  re-trying `spack install `gives: 
```
○ → spack install --keep-stage -v gcc@4.9.4 %gcc@4.4.7
........some install  stuff......

# oops....

/gcc-4.9.4/gcc/go/gofrontend/expressions.cc
packet_write_wait: Connection to 148.187.84.11: Broken pipe

# ssh and try to install again 

○ → spack install --keep-stage -v gcc@4.9.4 %gcc@4.4.7

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/somepath/spack/bin/spack", line 193, in <module>
    main()
  File "/somepath/spack/bin/spack", line 170, in main
    return_val = command(parser, args)
  File "/somepath/spack/lib/spack/spack/cmd/install.py", line 342, in install
    package.do_install(**kwargs)
  File "/somepath/spack/lib/spack/spack/package.py", line 1162, in do_install
    with self._prefix_read_lock():
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.6/contextlib.py", line 16, in __enter__
    return self.gen.next()
  File "/somepath/spack/lib/spack/spack/package.py", line 1106, in _prefix_read_lock
    self.prefix_lock.release_read()
  File "/somepath/spack/lib/spack/llnl/util/lock.py", line 238, in release_read
    assert self._reads > 0
AssertionError
```
I removed `install prefix/stage`, did `reindex` and able to install package.
